$interpreted: Li Hwa: How are you feeling? You were unconscious all afternoon.
Lian Hsi: ...Why did you bring me back here?
Li Hwa: You ought to stay at Pearl Manor. Here, this medicine will restore your strength. You'll feel a little better after drinking it.
Lian Hsi: Don't you both owe me an explanation? I'm not drinking anything until you clear everything up!
Li Hwa: ...Calm down. We should have told you about the letter, but...
Lian Hsi: Give me my ma's letter! And then let me go. I don't wanna stay here a moment longer.
Jing Yu: What's this on the floor... Hey you two, stop fighting!
Lian Hsi: Tell me the truth, Jing Yu. You and Li Hwa have been deceiving me, haven't you?
Jing Yu: What? Calm down. I'll just tidy this up first, and...
Li Hwa: Here's the letter. You can see for yourself. If you really insist on leaving after you've read it... then I won't stop you.
Lian Hsi: Why did you lie to me?
Li Hwa: We thought it would be too cruel to tell you the truth back then. I'm sorry, there was never a good time.
Li Hwa: Jing Yu went to your ma's house to look for her, but she'd moved away.
Lian Hsi: Moved? Didn't she want to see me again...
Li Hwa: Lian Hsi...
Lian Hsi: All she left was this letter. Not a thing for either of you... Why would you both go to so much trouble to look after me?
Li Hwa: At first we just wanted to heal you up and take you back home again. But I came to love our time together with you,
Li Hwa: And I hoped that our happy, healthy days together wouldn't have to end.
Li Hwa: Don't you believe me, Lian Hsi?
Lian Hsi: ...I believe you.
Li Hwa: It's been a long day, and you must be tired. I'm going to take another look through the textbooks. Won't you stay here and rest up?
Lian Hsi: Okay, Sister Li Hwa. You should get some rest, too.
Jing Yu: When I first came back to Pearl Manor, Li Hwa was so lifeless and dejected. It was only after you arrived that her spirits finally lifted.
Jing Yu: I'm so sorry we hid the truth about your mother from you...
Lian Hsi: I know Li Hwa only meant well for me. I know you don't think I'm any trouble, too...
Lian Hsi: I guessed a little of the truth after Ma didn't show up once in three whole years. But I never, ever thought she'd tell me to my face that she didn't want me anymore...
Jing Yu: All I can tell you is that you should stay here, at Pearl Manor. Li Hwa and I promise to take good care of you.
Lian Hsi: ...I know, Jing Yu. Thank you, both of you.
Lian Hsi: Sister Li Hwa, I don't understand this. Can you teach me?
Li Hwa: Okay, which part don't you understand?
Lian Hsi: You don't look too well, Li Hwa. You should stop and rest, or you'll end up hurting yourself...
Li Hwa: It's okay. I should be finding the right herbs to cure you with as soon as possible.
Li Hwa: Now, which part are you struggling with? Let me teach you.
Lian Hsi: Oh, it's nothing.
Li Hwa: Very well. Call me if you need anything.
Lian Hsi: (I wanna be cured, too, but... I don't want to lose your company...)
: Three months later...
Grateful Beast: Thanks for the medicines! My father's leg is much better now. I'd like to contribute something to help you set up a clinic!
Proud Doctor: It's my responsibility to heal the sick, but my pleasure to roam all around, too. Thank you for your kindness. As for your father's illness, however...
Li Hwa: (Lian Hsi's been blacking out more and more often. I have to find something to cure her with, and fast.)
Li Hwa: I'm sorry! Are you hurt?
Grateful Beast: Not at all, just be more careful next time!
Proud Doctor: Madam, I see the trouble written in your face. Is there anything you need help with?
Li Hwa: Uh... Thanks for your concern.
Grateful Beast: Ah! Aren't you... the Lady of Seamoon Manor?
Li Hwa: Aren't you... the one who asked me to heal your father, last time?
Grateful Beast: Yes! Thank you so much! ...You look exhausted, make sure you're taking care of yourself, too!
Li Hwa: I will, thank you.
Proud Doctor: You know, your father's leg was one thing, but I once saw an even stranger disease. Not long ago, I saw a Stingray with a mysterious illness. She was often losing consciousness,
Proud Doctor: But her blackouts were growing ever longer and more frequent. It took everything I had to figure out how to treat her!
Li Hwa: ...Hey, wait!

Model.Text: How are you feeling? You were unconscious all afternoon.
...Why did you bring me back here?
You ought to stay at Pearl Manor. Here, this medicine will restore your strength. You'll feel a little better after drinking it.
Don't you both owe me an explanation? I'm not drinking anything until you clear everything up!
...Calm down. We should have told you about the letter, but...
Give me my ma's letter! And then let me go. I don't wanna stay here a moment longer.
What's this on the floor... Hey you two, stop fighting!
Tell me the truth, Jing Yu. You and Li Hwa have been deceiving me, haven't you?
What? Calm down. I'll just tidy this up first, and...
Here's the letter. You can see for yourself. If you really insist on leaving after you've read it... then I won't stop you.
Why did you lie to me?
We thought it would be too cruel to tell you the truth back then. I'm sorry, there was never a good time.
Jing Yu went to your ma's house to look for her, but she'd moved away.
Moved? Didn't she want to see me again...
Lian Hsi...
All she left was this letter. Not a thing for either of you... Why would you both go to so much trouble to look after me?
At first we just wanted to heal you up and take you back home again. But I came to love our time together with you,
And I hoped that our happy, healthy days together wouldn't have to end.
Don't you believe me, Lian Hsi?
...I believe you.
It's been a long day, and you must be tired. I'm going to take another look through the textbooks. Won't you stay here and rest up?
Okay, Sister Li Hwa. You should get some rest, too.
When I first came back to Pearl Manor, Li Hwa was so lifeless and dejected. It was only after you arrived that her spirits finally lifted.
I'm so sorry we hid the truth about your mother from you...
I know Li Hwa only meant well for me. I know you don't think I'm any trouble, too...
I guessed a little of the truth after Ma didn't show up once in three whole years. But I never, ever thought she'd tell me to my face that she didn't want me anymore...
All I can tell you is that you should stay here, at Pearl Manor. Li Hwa and I promise to take good care of you.
...I know, Jing Yu. Thank you, both of you.
Sister Li Hwa, I don't understand this. Can you teach me?
Okay, which part don't you understand?
You don't look too well, Li Hwa. You should stop and rest, or you'll end up hurting yourself...
It's okay. I should be finding the right herbs to cure you with as soon as possible.
Now, which part are you struggling with? Let me teach you.
Oh, it's nothing.
Very well. Call me if you need anything.
(I wanna be cured, too, but... I don't want to lose your company...)
Three months later...
Thanks for the medicines! My father's leg is much better now. I'd like to contribute something to help you set up a clinic!
It's my responsibility to heal the sick, but my pleasure to roam all around, too. Thank you for your kindness. As for your father's illness, however...
(Lian Hsi's been blacking out more and more often. I have to find something to cure her with, and fast.)
I'm sorry! Are you hurt?
Not at all, just be more careful next time!
Madam, I see the trouble written in your face. Is there anything you need help with?
Uh... Thanks for your concern.
Ah! Aren't you... the Lady of Seamoon Manor?
Aren't you... the one who asked me to heal your father, last time?
Yes! Thank you so much! ...You look exhausted, make sure you're taking care of yourself, too!
I will, thank you.
You know, your father's leg was one thing, but I once saw an even stranger disease. Not long ago, I saw a Stingray with a mysterious illness. She was often losing consciousness,
But her blackouts were growing ever longer and more frequent. It took everything I had to figure out how to treat her!
...Hey, wait!
